page.title: 17MEANINGS OF STREET NAMES
page.content: Beancroft Close-Beans once grown here Church Lane -The lane to the church Church View -a view of the church Crossgates -Where Short Gate and Long Gate meet Daw Lane -named after Jackdaws High Street -The highest street Low Road Low street-The lowest street Manor Walk -Probably a walk to the manor Meadow Rise -Leading to the meadow on the hill New Road -Once a new road Ratten Row -A person's name Rockcliffe Drive-On the rocky hillside Sweet Lane -Wild flowers nearby Tofield Road -A person's name Wadworth Hall Lane-leads to Wadworth Hall Walnut Tree Hill-Probably a walnut tree on a hill There are 27 roads in Wadworth in all.
